page.title: 16FARMING AROUND MONTFORD
page.content:
The main land cover in this block consists of very productive farmland. A little over half is given over to arable crops and the remainder is intensively managed pasture. The major crops are sugar beet (which goes to the refinery at Allscott 12 miles away), potatoes, wheat and barley, grown in roughly equal proportions. Of the grass which is cut for winter fodder, increasing amounts are stored as silage rather than hay.
Dairy cattle, mostly Friesian, form the largest part of the farm stock and a large number of beef cattle are also kept. Some sheep are brought into the area from the Welsh hills in the winter to graze on the local pasture, sugar beet and other fodder crops.
